column4: hello. im trying to compile mplayer from the ubuntu wiki, i put this line: ./configure --enable-gui --enable-largefiles --enable-menu --prefix=/usr \
--confdir=/etc/mplayer but yet i get this error: MPlayer was compiled WITHOUT GUI support. why???!
unless you still have ubuntu 5.04 you don't need to compile your own mplayer anymore
ok, but dont you think the gui should work?
sudo apt-get build-dep mplayer
then rerun the ./configure
for every deb line in sources.list there should be a matching deb-src line
there is
not with ubuntu
a matching source line for the deb. in my sources.list.
oh
not commented out?
and you have universe and multiverse enabled?
remove the #s from the deb-src lines
yes
make clean first
sudo make clean or just make clean, then make install?
gconf-editor
YES thanks!!
it's hidden in the menus by default, you can use alacarte to unhide it
it's called Configuration Editor and it's in the System Tools menu
i just hit alt f2
